item.title: Benefit From The Great CAPEX to OPEX Migration
item.description: A significant shift is happening in the business world, moving away from traditional capital expenditures (CAPEX) towards operational expenses (OPEX). This change, although seemingly subtle, represents a fundamental shift with far-reaching implications for businesses of all sizes. Businesses incur both capital and operational expenses. Operational expenses are the costs of daily operations, like utilities, supplies, and salaries. Capital expenses, however, are long-term investments, such as purchasing buildings or major equipment. An example of this is an in-house PBX telephone system, which might soon be replaced by an operational expense alternative.
